usefulItems: ring mould (20 cm) (e.g. savarin or bundt tin), skewer, wire rack, oven
title: Blueberry and Lavender Bundt Cake

ingredients.content: 175 g unsalted butter, soft, plus extra for greasing
⅛ - ¼ tsp edible lavender, to taste, plus extra for garnish
purple food colouring paste, as desired

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C and grease a large bundt tin (20 cm).
Place 40 g sugar and edible lavender in mixing bowl then grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and remaining 230 g sugar then cream <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>.
Mix <b>30 sec/speed 3<b> while adding eggs one at a time through hole in mixing bowl lid.
Add buttermilk, flour and baking powder then mix <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>30 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add blueberries and gently fold in with spatula. Transfer to prepared tin. Bake for 1 hour-1 hour 10 minutes (170°C) until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Leave sponge to cool in tin for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once sponge is cool, place lavender and sugar in mixing bowl then grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add water and food colouring then mix <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>. Drizzle thick icing over cooled cake then scatter with extra edible lavender. Serve in slices.

hintsAndTricks: Alternatively, use 2 x Ø 20 cm cake tins and bake for 40-50 minutes (170°C) in step 6.
